taskbody.context: Use this procedure to stop the service (serviced) on the master host in a multi-host deployment.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Identify the top-level service serviced is managing.
step.stepresult: The top-level service is the service listed immediately below the headings line.

step.stepxmp: Replace Service with the name or identifier of the top-level service: serviced service stop Service

step.stepresult: When the status of the top-level service and all child services is stopped, proceed to the next step.

step.cmd: Ensure that no containers remain in the local repository.

substep.cmd: Display the identifiers of all containers, running and exited.

ul.li: If the command returns no result, stop. This procedure is complete.
If the command returns a result, perform the following substeps.

substep.cmd: Display the identifiers of all containers, running and exited.

ul.li: If the command returns no result, stop. This procedure is complete.
If the command returns a result, perform the remaining substeps.

substep.cmd: Disable the automatic startup of serviced.
Log in to the master host .
Enable the automatic startup of serviced.
